question: I’m tall when I’m young and short when I’m old. What am I?
What has to be broken before you can use it?
What has keys but can’t open locks?
What has hands but can’t clap?
What gets wetter the more it dries?
I’m full of holes but still hold water. What am I?
What can you catch but not throw?
What building has the most stories?
What goes up but never comes down?
What belongs to you but others use it more than you do?
I speak without a mouth and hear without ears. I have nobody, but I come alive with wind. What am I?
The more you take, the more you leave behind. What am I?
I’m light as a feather, yet the strongest person can’t hold me for five minutes. What am I?
I have cities but no houses, forests but no trees, and rivers with no water. What am I?
Forward I am heavy, backward I am not. What am I?
I have a neck but no head, two arms but no hands. What am I?
I can run but never walk, have a mouth but never talk. What am I?
I turn once, what is out will not get in. I turn again, what is in will not get out. What am I?
I’m taken from a mine and shut up in a wooden case, from which I am never released, and yet I am used by almost everyone. What am I?
I have roots nobody sees, I am taller than trees. Up, up I go, yet I never grow. What am I?
Two in a corner, one in a room, zero in a house, but one in a shelter. What is it?
I build up castles; I tear down mountains. I blind some men and help others to see. What am I?
I am always hungry, I must always be fed. The finger I touch will soon turn red. What am I?
I have keys that open no locks, space but no room, you can enter but not go inside. What am I?
What has one eye but can’t see?
What can travel around the world while staying in a corner?
What disappears as soon as you say its name?
I have a head and a tail but no body. What am I?
What has an eye but cannot see, and gets wetter as it dries?
I go up and down the stairs without moving. What am I?
What has many teeth but can’t bite?
If you drop me I’m sure to crack, but smile at me and I’ll smile back. What am I?
I have an eye but I’m blind. What am I?
What can fill a room but takes up no space?
What kind of coat is always wet when you put it on?
What runs all around a backyard, yet never moves?
What begins with T, ends with T, and has T in it?
What belongs to you but gets used by everyone else more than you?
What can you hold in your left hand but not in your right?
I have four legs in the morning, two in the afternoon, and three in the evening. What am I?
answer: human (the riddle of the Sphinx: baby, adult, elderly with cane)

question: What goes through towns and over hills but never moves?
What tastes better than it smells?
I have a face but no eyes, hands but no arms. What am I?
The more there is, the less you see. What is it?
What can be cracked, made, told, and played?
I fly without wings, I cry without eyes. Wherever I go, darkness follows me. What am I?
What is full of holes but still holds water?
What building has the most stories?
What goes up when the rain comes down?
I have a thumb and four fingers but I’m not alive. What am I?
What has words but never speaks?
What runs but never walks, has a mouth but never talks, has a head but never weeps?
What can you break, even if you never pick it up or touch it?
I’m found in socks, scarves and mittens; and often in the paws of playful kittens. What am I?
What room do ghosts avoid?
What invention lets you look right through a wall?
I shave every day, but my beard stays the same. What am I?
What kind of tree can you carry in your hand?
What goes up and never comes down?
What has a head, a tail, is brown, and has no legs?
What has one head, one foot and four legs?
I am easily lifted but hard to throw. What am I?
I have a bed but never sleep, I run but never walk. What am I?
I make two people out of one. What am I?
I am not alive, but I grow; I don’t have lungs, but I need air; I don’t have a mouth, but water kills me. What am I?
I go all around the world but always stay in a corner. What am I?
What has to be given before you can get it?
What has a ring but no finger?
What word becomes shorter when you add two letters to it?
I am always in front of you but can’t be seen. What am I?
I start out tall, but the longer I stand, the shorter I grow. What am I?
What tastes better than it smells?
I’m taken from a mine and shut up in a wooden case, from which I am never released, and yet I am used by almost everyone. What am I?
What can be seen once in a minute, twice in a moment, and never in a thousand years?
What is always in front of you but can’t be seen?
What begins with an E but only has one letter?
What kind of band never plays music?
What has many keys but can’t open a single lock?
What has a bottom at the top?
I have seas without water, coasts without sand, towns without people, mountains without land. What am I?
I am not alive but I can die; what am I?
What is so fragile that saying its name breaks it?
What has one eye but can’t see?
What kind of room has no doors or windows?
I’m white and I’m often served with tea; inside I’m yellow, but cooked I can be eaten. What am I?
What runs around the whole yard without moving?
What can you keep after giving to someone?
What goes up and down but doesn’t move?
What has many teeth but cannot bite?
What comes once in a minute, twice in a moment, but never in a thousand years?
What invention lets you see through walls?
What goes around the world but stays in a corner?
What building has the most stories?
What is always coming but never arrives?
What has a head, a tail, is brown, and has no legs?
What gets sharper the more you use it?
What train runs on water?
I am a word of letters three; add two and fewer there will be. What word am I?
What can you catch but not throw?
What goes up the chimney down but not down the chimney up?
I speak without a mouth and hear without ears. I have nobody, but I come alive with wind. What am I?
